title: Champions come from different eras?
body:
I remember once when lore was being discussed (before the ret-con) that games could possibly be placing characters together that would never actually have a chance to meet in the lore, which always struck me as odd considering the nature of how the Institute that set up league matches in the lore worked.

If League of Legends was basically like Super Smash Bros, where the characters come from different times or even places how would that sit with people and mess with their fav champions?

What if Riven came from the past when NOXUS was in it's hey day ready to rule over everything only to become this dark and sinister place and she's is trying to put it back to grand standards her way, while people try to keep her from going back to the past and changing the future? What if Thresh IS Lucian hundreds of years in the future? What is Ashe IS Avarosa from another timeline but she can't remember? What if Nocturne is Zed?

There seems to be a trend towards centering things to the back to Runeterra, such as the Nasus/Renekton lore changes. Even though it makes him unique I'm sure Taric's lore will have him as a native of Runeterra because a world hopping adventurer that gets stuck on another world might just incur HASBRO's wrath.

There are plenty of black holes at the moment but recent champions have lore in as such that they may not play a main role in some epic tale but they do have stories attributed to them. What if some of the other stories were all wrong though, not that we knew it?
